eu.opends.visualization

Class LightningData

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.opends.visualization.LightningData

  • public class LightningData
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents data used if the simulator is connected to Lightning. It contains methods to compute camera (and traffic light) position and orientation in the Lightning coordinate system.
    Author:
    Rafael Math

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LightningData() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String getCameraOrientation(com.jme3.renderer.Camera camera)
      Computes the orientation of the camera as Euler angles and returns a string of the following structure: "heading attitude bank".
      static java.lang.String getCameraPosition(com.jme3.renderer.Camera camera, float scalingFactor)
      Computes the position of the given camera in the Lightning coordinate system and multiplies x-, y- and z-coordinate with the given scaling factor.
      static void printTrafficLightInfos(TrafficLight trafficLight, float scalingFactor)
      Prints traffic light information, such as name, position and orientation.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LightningData

        public LightningData()

    • Method Detail

      • getCameraPosition

        public static java.lang.String getCameraPosition(com.jme3.renderer.Camera camera,
                                 float scalingFactor)
        Computes the position of the given camera in the Lightning coordinate system and multiplies x-, y- and z-coordinate with the given scaling factor.
        Parameters:
        camera - Camera to get data from.
        scalingFactor - Factor the position data is multiplied with.
        Returns:
        Position string containing scaled x-, y- and z-coordinates in the Lightning coordinate system.

      • getCameraOrientation

        public static java.lang.String getCameraOrientation(com.jme3.renderer.Camera camera)
        Computes the orientation of the camera as Euler angles and returns a string of the following structure: "heading attitude bank".
        Parameters:
        camera - Camera to get data from.
        Returns:
        Orientation string containing heading, attitude and bank as Euler angles.

      • printTrafficLightInfos

        public static void printTrafficLightInfos(TrafficLight trafficLight,
                          float scalingFactor)
        Prints traffic light information, such as name, position and orientation. This method can be used to place traffic lights in Lightning.
        Parameters:
        trafficLight - Traffic light object to get information about.
        scalingFactor - Factor the position data is multiplied with.
